metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1784 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The History implementation in WebKit in Apple iOS before 9.3, Safari before9.1, and tvOS before 9.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (resource consumption and application crash) via a crafted website.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkit2gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.9-1ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
